trans-unit.source: Supports the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource"></xref> control and provides an interface for data-bound controls to perform data retrieval using Structured Query Language (SQL) against a Microsoft Access database.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView> class is intended primarily to be used by data-bound controls and not as a programmable object in page code.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView> class is provided because Microsoft Access is a file-based database system and has several unique characteristics that set it apart from other SQL-based relational database products that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> control and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView> classes are used with.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView"></xref> class setting the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource"></xref> control as the owner of the current view.

The <xref:System.Web.HttpContext> object is used by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource> control to access the parameters in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.FilterParameters%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.SelectParameters%2A> collections when retrieving data.
The data source control with which the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView"></xref> is associated.
A unique name for the data source view, within the scope of the data source control that owns it.
The current <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext"></xref>.

Retrieves data from the underlying data storage using the SQL string in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.SelectCommand"></xref> property and any parameters in the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.SelectParameters"></xref> collection.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView> object overrides the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method to ensure that the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource.DataFile%2A> property of its associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource> control is set before retrieving data.

Before the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView.ExecuteSelect%2A> method is performed, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.OnSelecting%2A> method is called to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.Selecting> event.
You can handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.Selecting> event to examine the values of the parameters and to perform any preprocessing before a data retrieval operation.

To perform the data retrieval, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView> object builds an <xref:System.Data.IDbCommand> object using the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.SelectCommand%2A> text and any associated <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.SelectParameters%2A> properties.
Then, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView> object executes the <xref:System.Data.IDbCommand> object against the underlying data storage.
After the operation completes, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.OnSelected%2A> method is called to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Selected> event.
You can handle the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Selected> event to examine any return values and error codes and to perform any post-processing.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceMode.DataSet> value and caching is enabled, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSourceView> retrieves data from and saves data to the cache during the data retrieval operation.

The cache is created, discarded, or refreshed, based on the caching behavior that is specified by the combination of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.CacheDuration%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.CacheExpirationPolicy%2A> properties.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is set to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceMode.DataSet> value and a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.FilterExpression%2A> property has been specified, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.DataSourceMode%2A> property is evaluated along with any supplied <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSourceView.FilterParameters%2A> properties and the resulting filter is applied to the list of data during the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource.Select%2A> operation.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.DataSourceSelectArguments"></xref> that is used to request operations on the data beyond basic data retrieval.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> of data rows.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.AccessDataSource.DataFile"></xref> property is `null` or an empty string ("").

The arguments passed to the method specify that the data source should perform some additional work while retrieving data to enable paging or sorting through the retrieved data, but the data source control does not support the requested capability.
